test_description: This test covers basic database concepts including characteristics, file systems vs DBMS, data abstraction, architecture, and DBA roles.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of database systems?
What is the main disadvantage of file systems compared to database systems?
Which level of data abstraction describes how data is actually stored?
What does data independence refer to?
questions.options_a: Ability to change schema without affecting applications

questions.question: Which component of DBMS architecture is responsible for query processing?
What is the primary role of a Database Administrator (DBA)?
questions.options_a: Designing and maintaining the database system

questions.question: Which type of data independence allows changes to conceptual schema without affecting applications?
What is the purpose of the three-schema architecture?
questions.options_a: To separate user applications from the physical database

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically a responsibility of a DBA?
What is the main advantage of using a DBMS over file systems?
Which level of abstraction describes the entire database for a community of users?
What is the purpose of data dictionary in a DBMS?
questions.options_a: To store metadata about the database

questions.question: Which component of DBMS is responsible for concurrency control?
What is the main purpose of view level abstraction?
questions.options_a: To provide customized views of data for different users

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a function of a DBMS?
What is the purpose of logical data independence?
questions.options_a: To change logical schema without affecting external schema
questions.options_b: To change physical schema without affecting logical schema
questions.options_c: To change storage devices without affecting applications
questions.options_d: To change user interfaces without affecting data

questions.question: Which DBMS component is responsible for managing disk storage?
What is the primary advantage of database approach over file processing?
Which of the following is NOT a typical database user?
What is the purpose of physical data independence?
questions.options_a: To change physical schema without affecting logical schema
questions.options_b: To change logical schema without affecting views
questions.options_c: To change user interfaces without affecting data
questions.options_d: To change application programs without affecting data
